title: Scenario: Tapping Class drop down menu in top center
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user is on the News tab
custom_steps: When the user taps the Class icon in the top Center
custom_expected:
Then the MiLB classes should appear
And the user should see options to filter the news index by entire class after tapping on the class

title: Scenario: Choose filter for entire class
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user is on the News tab
custom_steps:
When the user selects the Filter options by tapping the MiLB logo
And the user selects the filter for the entire class
custom_expected:
Then the News filter should close and the user should be taken back to the News index
And the index should only show all articles for the selected class. 
*Test for ALL classes*

title: Verify: That class filter reflects mode of app
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the app is in either Triple-A or Double-A mode
custom_steps:
When the user navigates to the News section
And the user taps the MiLB logo to bring up the news filter
custom_expected:
Then the user should see the filters for the class that is currently active in the app:
If Triple-A is active, the user should see a Triple-A filter and filters for each Triple-A team.
If Double-A is active, the user should see a Double-A filter and filters for each Double-A team. 
*Test for ALL classes*

title: A list of article headlines should appear that match the corresponding index
custom_preconds: Given the app has been launched
custom_steps: When the News tab has been selected
custom_expected: Then a list of article headlines should appear that match the corresponding index with headlines, thumbnail images and dates.

title: Articles should have a thumbnail image, when there is no image a default MiLB (placeholder) image should appear
custom_preconds: Given the user has launched the app.
custom_steps: When the News button is selected.
custom_expected: Then the list of articles should load with a thumbnail image or placeholder image.

title: Articles should have a clear and legible headline
custom_preconds: Given the app has been launched
custom_steps: When the user taps the News button
custom_expected: Then the list of articles should load and the headlines should be clearly legible.

title: Articles should have a timestamp include both date and time - time should show EST
custom_preconds: Given the app has been launched
custom_steps: When the user taps the News button.
custom_expected: Then the list of articles should appear and should include a date and time stamp

title: Should be able to easily scroll to the bottom of the list of articles in the index
custom_preconds: Given the app has been launched
custom_steps:
When the user taps the News button
And attempts to scroll down the list of articles
custom_expected: Then the list should easily scroll to the bottom of the end of the list of articles.

title: Tapping an article cell in the main index should open the associated article
custom_preconds: Given the user is located in the News section
custom_steps: When the user taps an article in the main index
custom_expected: Then the associated article should open.

title: The article page should contain the headline, byline, and timestamp
custom_preconds: Given the user is in the News section
custom_steps: When the user taps an article from the new index
custom_expected: Then the article should open and the user should see 1) A headline, 2) A sub headline, 3) Byline, 4) Timestamp, 5) Article text.

title: Should be abe to easily scroll to the bottom of the article page
custom_preconds: Given the user has loaded a particular article
custom_steps: When the user attempts to scroll to the bottom of the article
custom_expected: Then the article should scroll without issue.

title: Should be able to tap the 'Next Article' section at bottom of article to navigate through all 25 articles
custom_preconds: Given the user has loaded a particular article from the MiLB index
custom_steps: When the user taps the 'Next Article' section at bottom of article
custom_expected: Then the article should flip to the next article in the list

title: Back button in upper left corner of article page should bring the user back to the MiLB index
custom_preconds: Given the user has loaded a particular article in the MiLB index
custom_steps: When the user taps the back button at the top of the window
custom_expected: Then the user should be brought back to the MiLB news index.

title: News: List of articles should be accurate and readable
custom_preconds: Given we have selected the News menu item
custom_steps: When we scroll through the news articles
custom_expected: Then the news articles will be accurate & readable

title: News: Scrolling through the List of Articles initially will display the MiLB.com placeholder icon while the images load
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected the News menu item
And we haven't scrolled through the articles yet
custom_steps: When we scroll through the articles
custom_expected: Then we will briefly see the MiLB.com placeholder icon while the appropriate images load

title: News: Verify we can traverse through news articles and that the thumbnails and formatting look correct
custom_preconds: Given we have selected the News menu item
custom_steps: When we navigate through the News articles
custom_expected:
Then all the news articles that we have traversed through look formatted correctly
And have their thumbnails load appropriately

title: News: By default the main news page will display 24 articles if they are available
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have the MiLB app installed
AND we launch the app
custom_steps: WHEN we select the News section
custom_expected: THEN the main news page will display up to 24 articles if they are available

title: News: Tapping on a News Article loads that particular article
custom_preconds: Given we have selected the News menu item
custom_steps: When we tap on a news article
custom_expected: Then that news article loads successfully

title: News: When inside an article swiping left or right will allow you to move between news articles
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected the News menu item
And we have tapped on a news article
custom_steps:
When we swipe left or right
Or we tap the back arrow in the top left corner
custom_expected:
Then it will allow us to navigate between news articles
Or take us back to the main news page (when using the back arrow button)

title: Verify News index does not refresh
custom_preconds: Given the user has navigated to the News view
custom_steps: When scrolling to any part of the News index
custom_expected:
Then the index will remain at the location set by the user
And will not scroll back to the top of the index after refreshing

title: News (Sharing): Verify if we open up a news article on a device iOS 5 and greater that there is a Twitter button available
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed At Bat on a device with an iOS version 5.0+
AND we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
WHEN we tap on the News button
AND we tap on a News Article
custom_expected:
THEN the ShareBar will be visible
AND we will see a Twitter Button
AND we will see a Facebook Button
AND we will see a Email Button
And we will see a Message Button

title: News (Sharing - Twitter): Verify that if we tap the Twitter button on a news article that it brings up a Tweet screen
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed At Bat
AND we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
WHEN we tap on the News button
AND we tap on a News Article
AND we tap on the twitter button
custom_expected:
THEN a Tweet screen will appear
AND the Tweet screen will contain a Cancel button
AND the Tweet screen will contain a Post button

title: News (Sharing - Twitter): Verify that if we tap the Twitter button on a news article that we can cancel out of the subsequent Tweet screen
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed At Bat
AND we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
WHEN we tap on the News button
AND we tap on a News Article
AND we tap on the twitter button
AND we tap on the Cancel button
custom_expected: THEN the Tweet screen will successfully close.

title: News (Sharing - Twitter): Verify that if we tap on the share button on a news article while not having a Twitter account set that Twitter will not appear in list
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed At Bat
AND we do NOT have a Twitter account setup on our device
AND we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
WHEN we tap on the News button
AND we tap on a News Article
AND we tap on the share button
custom_expected: THEN we will not see Twitter in the list of apps

title: News (Sharing - Twitter): Verify that if we tap the Twitter button on a news article while having multiple Twitter accounts setup that we will see a "From:" field that lets us switch between Twitter Accounts
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed At Bat
AND we have multiple Twitter Accounts setup on the device
AND we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
WHEN we tap on the News button
AND we tap on a News Article
AND we tap on the twitter button
custom_expected:
THEN we will see that a "From:" field exists
AND we will see that we can switch between Twitter accounts when tapping on it

title: News (Sharing - Twitter): Verify that if we tap the Send button on a Tweet that it successfully posts the Tweet to Twitter
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed At Bat
AND we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
WHEN we tap on the News button
AND we tap on a News Article
AND we tap on the twitter button
AND we tap on the Send button
custom_expected: THEN the Tweet will successfully post to Twitter

title: News (Sharing - Twitter): Verify that if we have posted a Tweet to Twitter that we see the following at the end of the Tweet: "with MILB <enterUrl>"
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed At Bat
AND we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
WHEN we tap on the News button
AND we tap on a News Article
AND we tap on the twitter button
AND we tap on the Send button
AND we check Twitter
custom_expected: THEN we see that the end of the Tweet contains:  "with MILB <enterUrl>"

title: News (Sharing - Facebook): Verify that if we tap the Facebook button on a news article that we can cancel out of the subsequent Facebook screen
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed At Bat
AND we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
WHEN we tap on the News button
AND we tap on a News Article
AND we tap on the Facebook button
AND we tap on the Cancel button
custom_expected: THEN we can successfully cancel out of the subsequent Facebook screen

title: News (Sharing - Facebook): Verify that if we tap the Share button on the Facebook UI screen that it will successfully post to Facebook
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed At Bat
AND we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
WHEN we tap on the News button
AND we tap on a News Article
AND we tap on the Facebook button
AND we tap on the Post button
custom_expected: THEN the comment will successfully post to Facebook

title: News (Sharing - Email): Verify that if we tap the Email button on a news article that it brings up the iOS default mail view
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed At Bat
AND we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
WHEN we tap on the News button
AND we tap on a News Article
AND we tap on the Email button
custom_expected: THEN the iOS default mail view will open

title: News (Sharing - Email): Verify that if we tap the Email button on a news article while having no Email account setup that we will be prompted with a message to set the account up in the devices Mail settings
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed At Bat
AND we currently do not have an Email Account setup
AND we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
WHEN we tap on the News button
AND we tap on a News Article
AND we tap on the Email button
custom_expected: THEN we will be prompted with a message of setting up our email account in Email Settings.

title: News (Sharing - Email): Verify that we can successfully send an email through the email flow
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed At Bat
AND we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
WHEN we tap on the News button
AND we tap on a News Article
AND we tap on the Email button
AND we send an Email
custom_expected:
THEN we will see the Email successfully send
AND the recipient will successfully receive the Email

title: News (Sharing) [IAB-5056]: Verify if the user isn't logged into iMessage and shares a message that it is sent as a Text Message instead
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed At Bat
AND we have launched the Application
AND we are currently not signed into iMessages
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate to News
AND we tap on a News Article
AND we tap on the Messages icon
AND we send a message
custom_expected:
THEN we will notice that the Message is sent as a Text Message
AND we will notice that the Message isn't sent as an iMessage

title: Scenario: Accessing News Index
custom_preconds:
Given At Bat has been launched 
And the user in on the Scoreboard
custom_steps: When the News icon in the tab tray in tapped
custom_expected: The News view will open

title: Scenario: News Index Defaults to MiLB.com News Page (of the class selected)
custom_preconds:
Given MiLB First Pitch is being launched for the first time
And the user is on the Scoreboard
custom_steps: When the News icon is tapped in the tab tray
custom_expected:
Then the News index will open
And will labeled Triple-A News in the navbar on top center

title: Scenario: Ensure that at least 15-20+ Articles Appear in Index (if available)
custom_preconds: Given the user has navigated to the News page
custom_steps: When counting the amount of articles in the index
custom_expected: Then user will find that there are at least 15-20 or more articles (if available)

title: Scenario: Ensure Index is Scrollable
custom_preconds: Given the user has navigated to the News page
custom_steps: When the user attempts to scroll up or down on the index
custom_expected:
Then the user will be able to do so with no difficulty
And the inertial scrolling will be smooth

title: Scenario: Favorite Team Selected
custom_preconds: Given the user has selected a favorite team/teams in the More section of At Bat
custom_steps: When the user navigates back to the Teams page
custom_expected: Then the selected favorite team/teams will be visible under the Favorite Teams header

title: Scenario: Tapping on News cell on team page Opens Team-Related Articles Only
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the Teams page
custom_steps: And taps one of the News cell
custom_expected:
Then the news articles index will open displaying the correct amount of articles

-Example(New Britain Rock Cats): http://www.milb.com/gen/2013/clubs/t538/topnews_ipad.xml

-compare what is in the above XML file to what's in the app, the # of articles should match, per team.

title: Scenario: Team News Article Index is Scrollable
custom_preconds: Given the user has navigated to News from the team's page
custom_steps: When the user attempts to scroll up or down on the index
custom_expected:
Then the user will be able to do so effortlessly
And inertial scrolling will be smooth

title: Scenario: All Articles Cells Are Formatted Properly and Are Legible
custom_preconds: Given the user is viewing any news index
custom_steps: When reviewing the contents of article cells
custom_expected:
Then the user will see a thumbnail on the left of the cell
And a title in bold black font
And a time/date stamp
And an abbreviated blurb

title: Scenario: Default Thumbnail Image Appears When None is Available
custom_preconds: Given the user has navigated to the News page
custom_steps: When there is no article specific thumbnail
custom_expected: Then a default grey scale MiLB.com logo will appear in its place

title: Scenario: Tapping on Cell Opens Article
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the News page
custom_steps: When the user taps on an article cell
custom_expected: Then the related article will open

title: Scenario: Swiping left or right through articles enables user to go backward or forward to previous or next article
custom_preconds:
Given the user has tapped on a article 
And the article is currently open
custom_steps:
When you swipe to the left
OR you swipe to the right
custom_expected:
Then previous/next article in the series of team articles will open
And the navbar will display the article number in the following format <article number> of <total team articles> (e.g. 15 of 28)

title: Scenario: Back Button
custom_preconds: Given the user has opened an article
custom_steps: When the Back button is tapped
custom_expected: Then the user will be taken back to the news index

title: Verify that if we switch to a different Class on News that specific class name will display on class selector button
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed Milb
AND we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate to News
AND we tap on the class selector on top center
AND we tap on a random class
custom_expected: THEN the class selector button will be replaced by that class name that was chosen

And a title in bold black font

custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a default gray scale MiLB.com logo will appear in its place

When an article is opened
And the user taps on the back button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken back to the news index

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN we navigate to News
AND we tap on the class selector on top center
AND we tap on a random class
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the class selector button will change to that class name that was chosen

custom_steps_separated.content:
When you open an article that has an embedded video
And you tap on the video to play it
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the video will play successfully
And you will be able to use the controls in media player

custom_steps_separated.content: When you open an article that has an embedded video
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the video will have the description at the bottom of the video thumbnail image
(iPhone) AND that description will match the "blurb" value found in the json for that article in http://www.milb.com/gen/2014/leagues/aaa/news_jsonv4.json

(iPad) AND that description will match the "bigblurb" value found in the json for that article in http://www.milb.com/gen/2014/leagues/aaa/news_jsonv4.json

custom_steps_separated.content:
When you open an article that has an embedded video
And you tap on the video thumbnail to play the video
And turn your device to landscape mode
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the video will play in landscape mode
And you can use the controls in the media player
And when you tap on Done on top left corner 
Then you will go back to the article

custom_steps_separated.content:
When you open an article that has an embedded video
And you tap on the video thumbnail to play the video
And you tap on the back button while video is playing
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then you will go back to the News index
And the video will have stopped playing

custom_steps_separated.content:
When you open an article that has an embedded video
And you tap on the video thumbnail to play the video
And you scroll down the article while video is playing
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the video will continue playing while you are scrolling

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is in the Videos tab
AND the user changes the class via the class picker in top center
AND the user taps on the News button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the News index will be changed to the class that was chosen in Videos
